Ingredients.2: 1 large butternut squash - peeled, seeded, and cut into chunks

Ingredients.5: 1  leek, thinly sliced (white and pale green parts only)

Ingredients.9: 6  parsnips, peeled and cut into chunks, or more to taste

Directions.1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Directions.2: Pour chicken broth into a large stockpot over medium-high heat; add squash, celery, apples, leek, garlic, allspice, and thyme. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook until the vegetables are completely tender, about 30 minutes.

Directions.3: While the vegetables simmer, put parsnips into a large bowl. Pour coconut oil over the parsnips and toss to coat. Spread parsnips onto a baking sheet.

Directions.4: Roast parsnips until tender and browned, about 30 minutes; add to soup.

Directions.5: Ladle vegetables and liquid into a blender in batches so the blender bowl is no more than half full. Hold lid in place with a towel and pulse blender a few times before leaving on to blend; puree until smooth. Repeat until all soup is pureed.

Directions.6: Pour pureed soup into the pot, stir half-and-half into the soup, and cook until hot, about 5 minutes.
